quest.name: The Hunter's Legacy
journal: Lue-Reeq appears to have been struck by an epiphany.

Despite not even bothering to venture outside the Crystarium whilst making cursory inquiries, Lue-Reeq has struck upon a new avenue of investigation into the whereabouts of Andreia. There is a prevailing theory that the Virtues, unlike most sin eaters, are driven by powerful memories that forever changed the course of the fallen heroes' lives. If true, then the memory you glimpsed of Andreia may hold a clue to where she might be found next. What you described to Lue-Reeq was apparently similar to a tale the would-be hunter heard when he was a child. Why he did not reach this conclusion sooner is anyone's guess, but the fact remains that he has now, which is why he urges you to accompany him back to Kholusia that you may question the wet nurse who first told him the story and determine if its hero and Renda-Rae are one and the same.

Miss Olvara, the kindly woman who all but single-handedly raised Lue-Reeq, confirms that the adventures of the brave hunter that she regaled him with in his youth were indeed those of Renda-Rae. Despite the slander and disdain heaped upon the Warriors of Light in the wake of the Flood, Miss Olvara and her fellow bounty hunters still celebrated Renda-Rae's feats and looked up to her as a hero. They swore to preserve them, even if only in secret, and pass them down to future generations that they might inspire others as they had them. And so, even after she had long since put up her bow and quiver, the wet nurse delighted in sharing Renda-Rae's grand adventures with little Lue-Reeq, who in turn decided to follow in the women's footsteps.

After Renda-Rae vowed to slay Balam–Quitz and avenge her fallen comrades, she carried on alone...until she met Ardbert and his fellow adventurers. To them she was a vibrant young woman who lived in the moment, for they knew nothing of her past, or how heavily it weighed upon her still. In secret she devised a means by which to defend against the beast's powerful roar, that she might be better prepared to face it should the opportunity arise─and arise it did when they found themselves in Rak'tika. Unwilling to divulge her past or endanger the lives of her dear friends, she resolved to face Balam–Quitz alone, and with all her strength and guile did she at last claim her vengeance in the Citia Swamps.

The theory proves accurate, for your search of the Citia Swamps leads you straight to Andreia, where you once more find yourself walking in the memories of Renda-Rae─much to Lue-Reeq's dismay. As Miss Olvara described, the hunter tracked down the scourge of Norvrandt, Balam–Quitz, and with bow in hand took aim at the beast that had stolen her comrades from her on that tragic day...

In a twist, you discover that Renda-Rae did not in fact slay Balam–Quitz by herself, but with the aid of Ardbert and the other Warriors of Light, who had come to her aid despite her efforts to keep them in the dark. However, when you emerge from your vision to share this revelation with Lue-Reeq, you are chastised by the young hunter who is angry that your visions have yet again cost you a chance to slay the Virtue. To your surprise, Lue-Reeq proclaims that he no longer has need of your services, and that upon your return to Gatetown, you will be given your final payment...

After sputtering some few words of irrational disappointment, Lue-Reeq departs in a huff, leaving you alone with Miss Olvara. As she watches him go, she explains that his behavior is likely an attempt to push you away before you do the same, as past experience has taught him that many of his so-called friends have only consorted with him for his prodigious wealth. She hopes you can find it in your heart to forgive him, and that you come and see her after taking some time to mull everything over.

※The next role quest will be available from Olvara upon reaching level 78 in any physical DPS class.

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Forename, my friend! Thank the gods you're here!

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Ever since we parted ways I've been exhausting myself running all over the Crystarium, questioning anyone and everyone, hoping someone might have seen Andreia, but alas...

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Only the Crystarium?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: So you haven't gone outside even for a bit?

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Well...of course! Surely this is the limit of what a man with meager financial resources can accomplish?

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: But never mind all that! For it but recently dawned on me that the vision you beheld of Renda-Rae's past could hold the clues for which we have been desperately searching!

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: When you first described it to me, I felt as though I had heard it before...and I had! My wet nurse had told me the exact same story when I was still a boy!

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: 'Twas a tale of a courageous hunter who together with her comrades embarked on a quest to slay a notorious mark─a great horned beast.

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: They came upon their quarry in a desert, and there attempted to lay it low. Alas, the beast had a singular strength, and the hunter a fatal weakness, and so in the ensuing struggle her comrades were killed, leaving her, the sole survivor, to swear vengeance.

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Would you not agree that your vision is a perfect match for this tale?

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Then there can be no doubt! Renda-Rae is the celebrated hunter─the hero I so admired in my childhood!

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: After that tragic day, the hunter resolved not to rely upon others and instead slew the beast by herself. She somehow found a way to compensate for her weakness...

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Anyway, my recollection of the tale is likely riddled with errors. We should ask Miss Olvara to recount it in full. She was a bounty hunter herself before she entered into our service, you know!

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Also, in light of all this, I should share with you an interesting theory concerning all the Virtues I heard from a fellow hunter. Apparently, each appears to be driven by particular memories─moments that forever changed each of these fallen heroes...

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Makes sense, doesn't it? Renda-Rae being a hunter of notorious marks in life and in death. I don't know why it never occurred to me before!

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: But if that is indeed the reason for why she behaves as she does, then the more we learn about Renda-Rae's adventures, the better our chances of predicting where she'll turn up.

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: All the more reason to go and see my former wet nurse. Miss Olvara lives in Gatetown, on Kholusia. Let us be off, then!

dialogue.name: OLVARA
dialogue.text: Oh, hello there. Are you a friend of Reeq's?

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Forename, this is Miss Olvara, the wet nurse who raised me for practically the entirety of my childhood. She was bonded to my family and lived with us in the city at the time, but when I came of age she was forced to leave...

dialogue.name: OLVARA
dialogue.text: My, you've grown into such a strapping young man! But...I can't imagine you came to Gatetown just to pay me a visit, my little Reeq?

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Not in front of herhim, if you please... But to answer your question, we did in fact come to see you.

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: There were stories you told me as a child of a courageous hunter. Was that hunter perchance the Warrior of Light, Renda-Rae?

dialogue.name: OLVARA
dialogue.text: Of all the reasons you could've had...

dialogue.name: OLVARA
dialogue.text: Aye, those stories were of Renda-Rae. The greatest bounty hunter of her day, the legend so many aspired to become.

dialogue.name: OLVARA
dialogue.text: Less so, after the Flood. It was still fresh in everyone's minds when I was younger, and for all the good they had done in life, none could deny the chaos they sowed in death. As sin eaters...

dialogue.name: OLVARA
dialogue.text: But despite all of that, me and my mates still looked up to her. We knew all her feats and swore to preserve them─in secret if need be─that she might inspire future generations as she had ours.

dialogue.name: OLVARA
dialogue.text: So years and years later, when you wanted to hear tales of adventure and heroism, I couldn't help but share with you the ones nearest and dearest to my heart. I only wish I hadn't had to change all the names.

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Then it's true. The hero who I looked up to as a child, whose tales of derring-do drove me to take up the bow, as you had─to pester you for training that I might become a bounty hunter...it was her.

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Miss Olvara. Forename and I are hunting Andreia, and we believe that one of the stories you shared with me may help guide our search. Namely, the one about the great horned beast that killed her friends. Will you tell it to me again?

dialogue.name: OLVARA
dialogue.text: Wicked white, is that... Oh, my little Reeq. Very well...

dialogue.name: OLVARA
dialogue.text: Even as a young hunter, Renda-Rae's incredible hearing was unparalleled. She could track her quarry through a forest by the most minute sounds of their passing─from malms away, even, by some accounts.

dialogue.name: OLVARA
dialogue.text: Even the most subtle and stealthy beasts never eluded her for long. A misplaced foot, a snapped branch─eventually, Renda-Rae would know, and her aim was always good and true.

dialogue.name: OLVARA
dialogue.text: As she grew older and honed her skills further, she set her eyes on bigger prizes. She became a hunter of notorious marks, and together with her comrades earned fame and fortune.

dialogue.name: OLVARA
dialogue.text: As their reputation swelled, so too did their egos. Only the most dangerous game would suffice. And so they resolved to hunt the scourge of Norvrandt, the devourer of souls─Balam–Quitz.

dialogue.name: OLVARA
dialogue.text: But what Renda-Rae did not realize was that her greatest strength would prove her undoing, for when she faced Balam–Quitz, the beast roared with such force that it brought her to her knees. Helpless, she could only watch as it claimed the lives of her beloved comrades and fled.

dialogue.name: OLVARA
dialogue.text: After burying the hunters and vowing that she would one day avenge them, she took to the road once more. She met Ardbert and his fellow Warriors of Light, and for a time she accompanied the fledgling heroes on their adventures.

dialogue.name: OLVARA
dialogue.text: To them, she was a breath of fresh air─a vibrant young woman who savored every moment and found joy in the simple pleasures. They knew naught of her fallen friends or how their deaths weighed heavy upon her still.

dialogue.name: OLVARA
dialogue.text: The party wandered the realm, performing many great deeds and growing ever stronger, as did Renda-Rae. While in Kholusia, she even devised a means to defend against the powerful roar that had been her downfall that fateful day.

dialogue.name: OLVARA
dialogue.text: And then, while engaged in an adventure in Rak'tika, a rumor reached Renda-Rae's ears. Balam–Quitz, scourge of Norvrandt, devourer of souls, had been spotted wandering the Citia Swamps.

dialogue.name: OLVARA
dialogue.text: 'Twas a golden opportunity, but to seize it would be to face the beast alone. She could not wait for Ardbert and the others, nor could she ask that they forsake their sworn duty.

dialogue.name: OLVARA
dialogue.text: But perhaps it was just as well...for the memory of her defeat still haunted her. The courageous hunter had allowed a single fear to take root in her heart: the fear of losing her new companions as she had her old.

dialogue.name: OLVARA
dialogue.text: So it was that Renda-Rae ventured forth in secret, resolved to slay her hated foe, Balam–Quitz, alone...

dialogue.name: OLVARA
dialogue.text: ...and with all her strength and guile the legendary hunter did just that.

dialogue.name: OLVARA
dialogue.text: Vengeance claimed, she rejoined Ardbert and the others, and never spoke of the terrible battle 'twixt her and the dread beast. From that day forward, she was Renda-Rae, the Warrior of Light, and the deeds of her and her comrades would be celebrated forevermore.

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: It's strange to think that the woman I admired when I was young would become the sin eater I swore to slay...

dialogue.name: OLVARA
dialogue.text: What she became doesn't change who she was. Even if the tales were a little embellished over the years, they were rooted in truth. She was and will always be a hero to me─and to you, I hope.

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Thank you, Miss Olvara, for everything. I promise I will visit you again soon.

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: So, Forename─remember that theory I told you before about the Virtues being driven by powerful memories? If Andreia is reenacting the journey leading up to her confrontation with Balam–Quitz─the one that took her from Amh Araeng to Kholusia─then her next destination must be...

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: The Rak'tika Greatwood, wasn't it?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: The Kingdom of Rainbows, Il Mheg.

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Right! That was where she laid low the beast at last─in the Citia Swamps, to be precise.

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Wait, what? No! She went to the Rak'tika Greatwood─the Citia Swamps, to be precise.

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: And so that is where we shall go. Let us away!

dialogue.name: OLVARA
dialogue.text: Now listen, Reeq: there's an awful lot people don't know about Renda-Rae. Or the world, for that matter.

dialogue.name: OLVARA
dialogue.text: So wherever you go and whatever you see, remember not to take it at face value. Don't just accept what others tell you as good and true. Listen to your heart and decide for yourself. And be safe.

dialogue.name: OLVARA
dialogue.text: Forename, was it? It is such a pleasure to meet a friend of Reeq's...

dialogue.name: OLVARA
dialogue.text: His parents never hesitated to provide him with all the wealth and opportunities they could, but when it came to love and support, well...all I can say is that it is a miracle that boy turned out as well as he did.

dialogue.name: OLVARA
dialogue.text: One can never have too many friends or too much support. That goes for you as well, I should think.

dialogue.name: OLVARA
dialogue.text: I know he may be a bit exhausting at times, but do try to be patient with Reeq.

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: When I was little, Miss Olvara seemed so much bigger and stronger than me. Though...to be perfectly honest, the way she carries herself even now bespeaks a confidence I cannot help but envy...

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: But never mind that! We have a Virtue to hunt! Let us commence our search at once─and keep your weapons at the ready, my friend...

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Heh, about time our luck took a turn for the better. There she is...

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: What? Now!? Oh, you've got to be kidding me!

dialogue.name: RENDARAE
dialogue.text: I wish you were all here with me...but I know it's better that you're not.

dialogue.name: RENDARAE
dialogue.text: We have a score to settle, you bloody bastard─and this time, I'm ready for your tricks...

dialogue.name: WARRIOROFDARKNESS
dialogue.text: Heh, tough ol' bugger. Everyone all right?

dialogue.name: RENDARAE
dialogue.text: Ardbert, I...I don't know what to say...

dialogue.name: RENDARAE
dialogue.text: Thank you, everyone...and I'm sorry for trying to go it alone.

dialogue.name: LAMITT
dialogue.text: And why, pray tell, did you even try to do something so foolish? If we'd been here from the first it wouldn't have been anything even approaching a challenge.

dialogue.name: RENDARAE
dialogue.text: Back in the day, I was a bounty hunter─I've told you that much. But I haven't told you about my old partners...

dialogue.name: RENDARAE
dialogue.text: Together, we tracked and claimed countless notorious marks throughout Norvrandt. We were the best in the business─everyone knew our names and our reputation. They called us legends...and somewhere along the line, we started to believe it too. And then we set our sights on Balam–Quitz...

dialogue.name: RENDARAE
dialogue.text: I survived, they didn't. I swore vengeance, but had no idea how to go about pursuing it. Then I met you lot, and thought that maybe, with your help, I might just have a fighting chance.

dialogue.name: RENDARAE
dialogue.text: So you see, I never intended to keep it all a secret. It's just...you never asked, and since I'd rather not talk about it...

dialogue.name: RENDARAE
dialogue.text: Easier to live in the moment, you know? The next town, the next job. The weeks flew by, and after a time, I...started having second thoughts.

dialogue.name: RENDARAE
dialogue.text: I'd lost those closest to me before. I didn't want to live through that again.

dialogue.name: WARRIOROFDARKNESS
dialogue.text: Are we or are we not comrades? Through thick and thin?

dialogue.name: WARRIOROFDARKNESS
dialogue.text: These bonds of fellowship between us must come before all else. Otherwise, they may as well not exist.

dialogue.name: WARRIOROFDARKNESS
dialogue.text: You say the thought of losing us pained you? What of our feelings? What of our loss? What if we had not arrived when we did!?

dialogue.name: WARRIOROFDARKNESS
dialogue.text: You've saved our lives more times than I can count─how dare you refuse to let us do the same!

dialogue.name: WARRIOROFDARKNESS
dialogue.text: ...And without those keen ears of yours, I'll never know what bollocks Branden and Nyelbert are whispering about me behind my back! And ignorance is not bliss, let me tell you!

dialogue.name: WARRIOROFDARKNESS
dialogue.text: This one's worth a fortune, aye? And fame besides. I'll wager we won't have to pay for our drinks when we get back into town!

dialogue.name: NYELBERT
dialogue.text: Oh gods, not another night to remember...

dialogue.name: BRANDEN
dialogue.text: Don't you worry your pretty head over our fearless leader's questionable constitution! Take pride in the victory, for the smallfolk will sleep easy once they hear of Balam–Quitz's demise...until Ardbert's drunken snoring wakes them from their slumber.

dialogue.name: WARRIOROFDARKNESS
dialogue.text: And on that note, I think it time we quit this place! And Renda-Rae─I trust that the next time you decide to hunt deadly game, you'll do us the courtesy of extending us an invitation?

dialogue.name: RENDARAE
dialogue.text: And there I thought I was doing you a favor by keeping you out of my personal affairs...selfish as it was...

dialogue.name: RENDARAE
dialogue.text: Oh, fine! But if you go and die on me, I'll pay a necromancer to raise you from the dead so I can kill you out of spite!

dialogue.name: WARRIOROFDARKNESS
dialogue.text: Agreed! Now then─mind cutting off whatever it is you need to take back as proof of the kill? I don't want to lose our reward on a technicality.

dialogue.name: CYLVA
dialogue.text: Such a fine crystal. Why not hold on to it as a memento of this occasion?

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Wake up, damn you! Hello!?

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: What's wrong with you, huh? That's the second time your so-called “gift” has cost us a chance at slaying Andreia!

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: You...you know what? I've had enough!

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Enough, I say! Yes! I don't need your help! I am perfectly capable of hunting the sin eater on my own!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Uh...good luck with that.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: It's past time I told you piss off.

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Upon our return to Gatetown, you will be given your final payment, and we will be free to go our separate ways...

dialogue.name: OLVARA
dialogue.text: ...What is it? Did something happen between you two?

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Honestly, I don't know why I ever placed my faith in you. You are...such a disappointment... Hmph!

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: Consider this the formal dissolution of our partnership. Let none ever again speak the names Reeq and Forename in the same breath─yes, never again. And with that, I bid you good day.

dialogue.name: OLVARA
dialogue.text: When he was little, Reeq's parents punished him for a time by withholding his allowance. Without money to lavish on his “friends,” he soon found that many were only drawn to him by his wealth. I daresay he feared you would abandon him as they did, and decided to push you away first...

dialogue.name: OLVARA
dialogue.text: I'm not trying to make excuses for what he said. I only hope you can find it in your heart to forgive him. Take some time to think it over, then come and see me. Oh, and take this for your troubles.
